basics.name: Aarre Laakso
basics.label: Editor
basics.summary: Innovative full service editor with a passion for helping teams clearly communicate complex ideas.

work.name: World Bank Group, Washington, DC
highlights: Contributed to and edited evaluations and technical reports on competitiveness, finance, innovation, entrepreneurship, the investment climate, trade, and other matters related to the private and financial sectors in Latin America, the Caribbean, Europe, Central Asia, and globally.
Worked as part of teams to write cohesive and persuasive documents that tell compelling stories, present cogent arguments backed by solid evidence, and comply with various requirements.

Identified deficiencies (including errors, omissions, inconsistencies, and insufficient evidence) in written work and corrected them or brought them to the attention of the appropriate colleagues in order to ensure a compelling written product.
Performed research to find information to support the arguments in written documents.
Created illustrations, charts, tables, and text boxes to showcase key concepts where they were relevant within a longer document.
Participated in formal and informal review processes.

work.name: Washtenaw Community College, Ann Arbor, MI
highlights: Designed and taught courses in introductory psychology and child development.

work.name: University of Michigan - Dearborn, Dearborn, MI
highlights: Designed and taught college courses on introductory psychology, cognitive psychology, and experimental psychology, including how to write research papers.
Novel uses of information technology in teaching.
Mentored undergraduate researchers on scientific research and writing.

work.name: Indiana University. Bloomington, IN
highlights: Teach college courses on cognitive psychology.
Novel uses of information technology in teaching.

education.institution: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

skills.name: Research
keywords: Finding and Summarizing Relevant Reports and Peer Reviewed Literature
